Module contents

class pysipfenn.Calculator[source]

Bases: object

pySIPFENN Calculator automatically initializes all functionalities. This includes identification and loading of all available models defined statically in models.json file.

runFromDirectory(directory: str, descriptor: str, mode='serial', max_workers=4)[source]

runModels(descriptor: str, structList: List[Structure], mode='serial', max_workers=4) → list[source]

Runs all loaded models on a list of Structures using specified descriptor. Supports serial and parallel computation modes. If parallel is selected, max_workers determines number of processes handling the featurization of structures (90-99+% of computational intensity) and models are then run in series.

Args:

descriptor (): Name of the descriptor (i.e. feature vector type) to be used. This selection determines which models can and will be automatically run. structList (): A list of atomic structures. mode (): Determines serial or parallel execution of descriptor calculation. max_workers (): If parallel mode is selected, it determines the number of processes which will be initiated by the Calculator to calculate structural descriptors.

Returns:

A list of predictions corresponding to the structList entries.

runModels_dilute(descriptor: str, structList: list, baseStruct='pure', mode='serial', max_workers=4)[source]
updateModelAvailability()[source]

Updates availability of models based on the pysipfenn.modelsSIPFENN directory contents. Works only for current ONNX model definitions. Legacy support for MxNet models is retained in other functions, but they have to be manually added here.
